input_text:
Job Title: Sr  Engineer - MSAT Pkg  CoE

Location: Titusville, NJ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Description:

Johnson & Johnson Services Inc LLC, Inc., a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Sr. Engineer - MSAT Pkg. CoE!

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

We combine our proven strengths with innovation to meet the needs of today and tomorrow. To build up and strengthen our team, we are looking for hardworking and dedicated people. Apply today for this exciting opening!

Support the deployment of the IMSC vision "Transforming our world, delivering affordable medicines to anyone, anywhere, any day by focusing on driving performance of the manufacturing network, its physical assets, processes, products and technical resources and optimizing Cost of Goods produced.

Provide packaging engineering support to technical design and standards for packaging equipment, secondary and tertiary lifecycle, packaging technical transfer and new product launch projects for all of IMSC's packaging sites and external contracting sites, as applicable. Closely work together with other functional areas (MSAT, Packaging Operations, Planning, Value Chain Management, Supply Chain Development Leads, Technical Launch Integrators, site Packaging Engineers, packaging equipment and packaging materials vendors, among others) to achieve business results and serve as a recognized representative for the MSAT CoE - Packaging Team.

Key Responsibilities:

Provide lifecycle packaging equipment, process technology transfer and new product launch technical support as required by internal Innovative Medicine Supply Chain (IMSC) sites and/or external contract sites in alignment with current and in-process standards, including packaging component drawings and specifications, Commissioning and Qualification (C&Q), distribution testing and Process Performance Validation (PPV/PPQ) across all IMSC/MTO platforms (SM and LM platforms).Coordinate activities and technology transfers, new product launch and equipment installation projects in alignment with site management and key stakeholders, internal (IMSC) and external (PES). Provide technical support in confirming that packaging technology and Engineering standards are met across the sites. Provide site technical support (internal & external) with packaging related quality and compliance investigations related to new product introductions and/or technical transfers of secondary and distribution packaging operations.Work with our packaging sites to identify and deliver cost improvement or cost avoidance projects that result in lower unit cost. In addition, support the sites with line efficiency improvement initiatives / activities, as required. Lead and connect directly to establish teamwork and support partnerships within IMSC teams (VCM, TLI, SCDL, Deliver, TDS, PES, MSAT, EQ, among others) as required.Provide support on different packaging needs related to packaging technology transfers and new product launch projects Define the final project objectives and deliverables with the new product introduction/technical transfer project team. Use of FPX & Six Sigma as a project methodology where possible.Challenge the organization and focus on the needs of the customers and the business.Introduce sustainable packaging solutions for packaging materials/components within new product introduction and/or technical transfers projects.

Qualifications:

Education:

Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field, required. Focused degree in packaging or related area is preferred. 

Experience and Skills:

Required: 

Minimum of 6 years of packaging engineering and/or design, or proven experience Knowledge of packaging equipment is required. Secondary and distribution packaging material design experience Understanding of cGMP, Good Documentation Practices, and Regulations is required. The ability to lead and/or support multiple projects simultaneously is required. Web training / Change Control and Event Management System Document Management Systems (Global document management program, SharePoint, Training)Experience with artwork/graphics management systems is required.Experience with Packaging Process Performance Qualification (PPQ) strategy and execution is required.

Preferred:

SAP/MRP system experiencePrimary packaging material experience Knowledge of temperature control/cold chain distribution and its application to pharma & medical device products 

Other:

Ability to travel up to 10% of the time, domestic 

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $90,000- $144,900 USD. The base salary range listed is based on a US pay scale and may be adjusted based on the successful candidate’s geographic location

The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.

Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.

Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).

Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:

Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar yearSick time - up to 40 hours per calendar yearHoliday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar yearWork, Personal, and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year

Additional information can be found through the link below. For additional general information on Company benefits, please go to: https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits.

This job posting is anticipated to close on April 23, 2024. The Company may however extend this time-period, in which case the posting will remain available on https://www.careers.jnj.com to accept additional applications.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.]

Experience Level (if available): None
